intro: Prunus chamaemespilus, commonly known as the common mazzard, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring slender, arching branches and small, oval-shaped leaves that are dark green on top and pale underneath. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, which are followed by edible, yellow berries. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, hedgerows, and rocky areas.
